verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Hold <S%H2790><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thy peace, O God <S%H430><s%> of my praise; <S%H8416><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> and the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the deceitful <S%H4820><s%> are opened <S%H6605><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me: they have spoken <S%H1696><s%> against <S%H854><s%> me with a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue. <S%H3956><s%>
They compassed me about <S%H5437><s%> also with words <S%H1697><s%> of hatred; <S%H8135><s%> and fought against <S%H3898><s%> me without a cause. <S%H2600><s%>
For <S%H8478><s%> my love <S%H160><s%> they are my adversaries: <S%H7853><s%> but I <S%H589><s%> give myself unto prayer. <S%H8605><s%>
And they have rewarded <S%H7760><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me evil <S%H7451><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> and hatred <S%H8135><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> my love. <S%H160><s%>
Set <S%H6485><s%> thou a wicked man <S%H7563><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> him: and let Satan <S%H7854><s%> stand <S%H5975><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> his right hand. <S%H3225><s%>
When he shall be judged, <S%H8199><s%> let him be condemned: <S%H3318><s%> <S%H7563><s%> and let <S%H3318><s%> his prayer <S%H8605><s%> become <S%H1961><s%> sin. <S%H2401><s%>
Let his days <S%H3117><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> few; <S%H4592><s%> and let another <S%H312><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> his office. <S%H6486><s%>
Let his children <S%H1121><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> a widow. <S%H490><s%>

Let his children <S%H1121><s%> be continually vagabonds, <S%H5128><s%> <S%H5128><s%> and beg: <S%H7592><s%> let them seek <S%H1875><s%> their bread also out of their desolate places. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2723><s%>
Let the extortioner <S%H5383><s%> catch <S%H5367><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he hath; and let the strangers <S%H2114><s%> spoil <S%H962><s%> his labor. <S%H3018><s%>

Let there be <S%H1961><s%> none <S%H408><s%> to extend <S%H4900><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%> unto him: neither <S%H408><s%> let there be <S%H1961><s%> any to favor <S%H2603><s%> his fatherless children. <S%H3490><s%>
Let his posterity <S%H319><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> cut off; <S%H3772><s%> and in the generation <S%H1755><s%> following <S%H312><s%> let their name <S%H8034><s%> be blotted out. <S%H4229><s%>

Let the iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of his fathers <S%H1><s%> be remembered <S%H2142><s%> with <S%H413><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> and let not <S%H408><s%> the sin <S%H2403><s%> of his mother <S%H517><s%> be blotted out. <S%H4229><s%>

Let them be <S%H1961><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> continually, <S%H8548><s%> that he may cut off <S%H3772><s%> the memory <S%H2143><s%> of them from the earth. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H776><s%>

Because <S%H3282><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he remembered <S%H2142><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> to show <S%H6213><s%> mercy, <S%H2617><s%> but persecuted <S%H7291><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> that he might even slay <S%H4191><s%> the broken <S%H3512><s%> in heart. <S%H3824><s%>

As he loved <S%H157><s%> cursing, <S%H7045><s%> so let it come <S%H935><s%> unto him: as he delighted <S%H2654><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> in blessing, <S%H1293><s%> so let it be far <S%H7368><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> him.

As he clothed <S%H3847><s%> himself with cursing <S%H7045><s%> like as with his garment, <S%H4055><s%> so let it come <S%H935><s%> into his bowels <S%H7130><s%> like water, <S%H4325><s%> and like oil <S%H8081><s%> into his bones. <S%H6106><s%>
Let it be <S%H1961><s%> unto him as the garment <S%H899><s%> which covereth <S%H5844><s%> him, and for a girdle <S%H4206><s%> wherewith he is girded <S%H2296><s%> continually. <S%H8548><s%>

Let this <S%H2063><s%> be the reward <S%H6468><s%> of mine adversaries <S%H7853><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H854><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and of them that speak <S%H1696><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> my soul. <S%H5315><s%>

But do <S%H6213><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> for <S%H854><s%> me, O GOD <S%H3069><s%> the Lord, <S%H136><s%> for thy name's sake: <S%H4616><s%> <S%H8034><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> thy mercy <S%H2617><s%> is good, <S%H2896><s%> deliver <S%H5337><s%> thou me.
For <S%H3588><s%> I <S%H595><s%> am poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy, <S%H34><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> is wounded <S%H2490><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me.
I am gone <S%H1980><s%> like the shadow <S%H6738><s%> when it declineth: <S%H5186><s%> I am tossed up and down <S%H5287><s%> as the locust. <S%H697><s%>
My knees <S%H1290><s%> are weak <S%H3782><s%> through fasting; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6685><s%> and my flesh <S%H1320><s%> faileth <S%H3584><s%> of fatness. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8081><s%>
I <S%H589><s%> became <S%H1961><s%> also a reproach <S%H2781><s%> unto them: when they looked upon <S%H7200><s%> me they shaked <S%H5128><s%> their heads. <S%H7218><s%>
Help <S%H5826><s%> me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God: <S%H430><s%> O save <S%H3467><s%> me according to thy mercy: <S%H2617><s%>
That <S%H3588><s%> they may know <S%H3045><s%> that this <S%H2063><s%> is thy hand; <S%H3027><s%> that thou, <S%H859><s%> LORD, <S%H3068><s%> hast done <S%H6213><s%> it.

Let them <S%H1992><s%> curse, <S%H7043><s%> but bless <S%H1288><s%> thou: <S%H859><s%> when they arise, <S%H6965><s%> let them be ashamed; <S%H954><s%> but let thy servant <S%H5650><s%> rejoice. <S%H8055><s%>

Let mine adversaries <S%H7853><s%> be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame, <S%H3639><s%> and let them cover <S%H5844><s%> themselves with their own confusion, <S%H1322><s%> as with a mantle. <S%H4598><s%>
I will greatly <S%H3966><s%> praise <S%H3034><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> with my mouth; <S%H6310><s%> yea, I will praise <S%H1984><s%> him among <S%H8432><s%> the multitude. <S%H7227><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> he shall stand <S%H5975><s%> at the right hand <S%H3225><s%> of the poor, <S%H34><s%> to save <S%H3467><s%> him from those that condemn <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8199><s%> his soul. <S%H5315><s%>
